        protected abstract void DecisionTurn()
        an extra space for decisions, reports, etc... between rounds

      • TestGameEndCondition

        protected abstract boolean TestGameEndCondition()
        a function that tests if the game has ended. returns "should continue?", not "are we there yet?" or rather, confirms in the positive, not the negative.
        Returns:

      • ScoreGame

        protected abstract void ScoreGame()
        The game needs to be scored. Who won? was there a tie?

      • Reset

        protected abstract void Reset()
        Reset, necessary if you would like persistent objects in Games list.

      • ScoreRank

        protected abstract int ScoreRank(Rank rank)
        For mapping ranks given game state or other 'funky' situations. Ex. in black jack, an ace can switch from 11 to 2, when needed.
        Parameters:
        rank -
        Returns:

      • CreateDeck

        protected void CreateDeck()
        Create Deck. All Games share this sequence. Instantiates dependents and then loops through the rank and suit lists to create a complete deck, and then shuffles.

      • PlayGame

        public void PlayGame()
        Persistent game flow for all CardGames. Display Menu, Create Deck, Start Game. Then loop. Computer turn (computer is always first), Player turn, and decision round until the End condition is met, or user exits. Then the game is scored and the game is reset.

      • GetTitle

        public java.lang.String GetTitle()
        the title to be set in the base class constructor helps for things like print a common phrase.
        Returns:
